title: Virgin looks to retail investors in rare listed debt raising
text:
Virgin Australia will spend the coming days in front of investors seeking buyers for a rare $150 million listed debt offer.

It is understood Virgin management will meet investors in Sydney on Monday and Melbourne and Brisbane on Wednesday, in meetings arranged by its sponsor brokers.

Virgin CEO Paul Scurrah is pitching a $150 million-odd debt raising to retail investors. Janie Barrett

The deal sees Virgin trying to widen its investor base via an offer of listed debt securities, with proceeds to help fund its purchase of a 35 per cent stake in Velocity Frequent Flyers.

It's a rare move by Virgin, which already has bank debt, Australian and US denominated bonds on its balance sheet, and a share register dominated by strategic investors.

It understood one of the primary reasons for going down the listed debt route was to tap into retail investor money and find investors that cannot participate in raisings like institutional placements or the wholesale bond offers. There's also plenty of demand for yield in retail broker land, as seen by a spate of listed credit fund and property sector raisings.
description: The airline is raising $150 million via listed debt securities and hopes to snare some retail investor money.
